questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the code from the bottom onto the box where the code is missing to construct a UCS XML API request to generate two service profiles from the template org-root/ls-service-template. Not all options are used.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
```
<lsInstantiateNNamedTemplate
 dn="org-root/ls-service-template-001"
 cookie="<real_cookie>"
 inTargetOrg="org-root"
 inHierarchical="no">
 <inNameSet>
 <dn value="service-profile-A"/>
 <dn value="service-profile-B"/>
 <dn value="service-profile-C"/>
 </inNameSet>
</lsInstantiateNNamedTemplate>
```
From:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/sw/api/UCSM_API_Guide/b_UCSM_API_Guide_3_1_chapter_011.html#r_lsinstantiatennamedtemplate
the given answer is correct.

Given asnwer is correct,API it's version0, not version1:
https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api/#!get-network-floor-plan

Given answer is correct:
networkID
floorPlanID
payload

Source:
https://developer.cisco.com/meraki/api-latest/#!get-network-floor-plan
given answer is correct.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer needs to implement REST API error handling when a timeout or rate limit scenario is present. Which code snippet must be placed into the blank in the code to complete the API request?

discussion.content:
Answer C:
429 produces "retry-after" which is used in the code.
408 does not produce "retry-after" so you need to define a backoff-time yourself

Selected Answer: D
429 is too many requests and therefore you back off continuously until you are allowed to request again, whereas 408 is request timeout because client did not produce a request within the time that the server is prepared to wait.

comments.content: Based on this answer it should be C

C is the correct answer because the code gets the "retry-after" in the answer segment which the 408 does not provide. This is why it does not access the "retry-after" header when you read the remainder of the code.

How is that possible when I selected D specifically? D is the correct answer. The code shown in the exhibit shows the code to process 429 errors. So before that, you would check for 408 errors with if response.status_code == 408:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer D for sure.
 
First catch the timeout (408, which don’t give back a retry-after). If that is not the case catch the 429 which gives a timeout and is further handled in the code given.

Selected Answer: C
C is the only one that makes sense. "retry after" is for rate limiting errors

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer . 429 ==> has retry after header and 408 dont.

Selected Answer: C
С is correct 
Best explanation:
429 produces "retry-after" which is used in the code.
408 does not produce "retry-after" so you need to define a backoff-time yourself

Selected Answer: C
As f2b48 says:
429 produces "retry-after" which is used in the code.
408 does not produce "retry-after" so you need to define a backoff-time yourself
